SEARCH:
Package jborg.lightning

Klasse LatticeGrid

java.lang.Object
jborg.lightning.LatticeGrid
public class LatticeGrid extends Object
It holds the Data where the 'Lattices' are which are Barriers to the Snake.

  • Konstruktordetails

    • LatticeGrid

      public LatticeGrid(int width, int height)
      Parameter:
      width - is the max. of how far x-Coordinate of a Lattice goes. How far right a Lattice can be. The min.=0 always.
      height - is the max of how far y-Coordiante of a Lattice goes. How far down a Lattice can be. The min.=0 always.

  • Methodendetails

    • setLatticesOnTile

      public void setLatticesOnTile(Point p, boolean[] latticeBits) throws jborg.lightning.exceptions.LTGCException
      Can potentially set or un-set multiple Lattices around the Tile specified by p.
      Parameter:
      p - contains the Tile Coordinates the Lattices is bordering on.
      latticeBits - determines where are the Lattices are. bit 0: left. bit 1: bottom. bit 2: right. bit 3: top.
      Löst aus:
      jborg.lightning.exceptions.LTGCException

    • setLatticesOnTile

      public void setLatticesOnTile(int x, int y, boolean[] latticeBits) throws jborg.lightning.exceptions.LTGCException
      Can potentially set or un-set multiple Lattices. If u set a Lattice-bit true that means a Lattice appears in specific Position relative to x and y.
      Parameter:
      x - contains the Tile x-Coordinate the Lattices is bordering on.
      y - contains the Tile y-Coordinate the Lattices is bordering on.
      latticeBits - determines where are the Lattices are. bit 0: left. bit 1: bottom. bit 2: right. bit 3: top.
      Löst aus:
      jborg.lightning.exceptions.LTGCException

    • setOneLatticeOnTile

      public void setOneLatticeOnTile(Point p, int bitNr) throws jborg.lightning.exceptions.LTGCException
      Sets one Lattice relative on a Tile.
      Parameter:
      p - Tile Coordinate.
      bitNr - from 0 to 3. Similar to latticeCodes. 0 means: left of the Tile a lattice will be. 1 means: bottom of the Tile a lattice will be. 2 means: right of the Tile a lattice will be. 3 means: top of the Tile a lattice will be. Other values will make a LTGCException happen to be thrown.
      Löst aus:
      jborg.lightning.exceptions.LTGCException - if p is beyond the width and/or height of the LatticeGrid. Also when p is null.

    • setOneLatticeOnTile

      public void setOneLatticeOnTile(int x, int y, int bitNr) throws jborg.lightning.exceptions.LTGCException
      Löst aus:
      jborg.lightning.exceptions.LTGCException

    • setLatticesOnTile

      public void setLatticesOnTile(Point p, int latticeCode) throws jborg.lightning.exceptions.LTGCException
      Can potentially set more than one Lattice or 'un-set' One needs to know the corresponding latticeCode.
      Parameter:
      p - Tile Coordinates.
      latticeCode - determines which lattices will appear.
      Löst aus:
      jborg.lightning.exceptions.LTGCException - if p is beyond the width or height or when p is null.

    • setLatticesOnTile

      public void setLatticesOnTile(int x, int y, int latticeCode) throws jborg.lightning.exceptions.LTGCException
      This is the workhorse. The cashCow. The chosen one. It handles the fact that: one Tiles right lattice is another Tiles left Lattice. All setLattic(es)blabla Methods rely on this one Method.
      Parameter:
      x - x-Coordinate of the Tile in question.
      y - y-Coordinate of the Tile in question.
      latticeCode - determines which Lattices are set or un-set.
      Löst aus:
      jborg.lightning.exceptions.LTGCException - if x and/or y are out of Bounds.(max./min.)(width/height).

    • translateLatticeBitsToLatticeCode

      public static int translateLatticeBitsToLatticeCode(boolean[] latticeBits) throws jborg.lightning.exceptions.LTGCException
      If u for some reason have a valid latticeBit Array and u want to know the corresponding latticeCode.
      Parameter:
      latticeBits - Array which contains min. nrOfLatticeBits. Which is four.
      Gibt zurück:
      latticeCode.
      Löst aus:
      jborg.lightning.exceptions.LTGCException - if the Array is too small. Or if the hole Array is null.

    • translateLatticeCodeToLatticeBits

      public static boolean[] translateLatticeCodeToLatticeBits(int latticeCode) throws jborg.lightning.exceptions.LTGCException
      If u for some reason have a valid latticeCode and u want to know the corresponding Lattice-bit Array.
      Parameter:
      latticeCode - Array which contains min. nrOfLatticeBits. Which is four.
      Gibt zurück:
      latticeBits.
      Löst aus:
      jborg.lightning.exceptions.LTGCException - if the Array is too small. Or if the hole Array is null.
